title.narrative: Africa Regional (Kenya, Tanzania and Uganda): RECAP: Human Rights and Healthy Diets Research Support Initiative

description.narrative: 1) To generate knowledge on how human rights frameworks, legal instruments and local and global actors can support a human rights-based approach to promoting healthy diets in developing countries. 2) To identify knowledge gaps, capacity needs, and other barriers and opportunities for researchers, civil society organizations and policymakers working to promote healthy diets through human rights-based approaches. 3) To share experiences and facilitate national and international collaboration among researchers, civil society organizations and policymakers about human rights-based approaches to promoting healthy diets.

Government officials working in the ministries or agencies responsible for legislative and regulatory responses to non-communicable diseases (NCDs), academic institutions, patients’ groups, children’s rights organisations, women’s organisations, youth groups, labor groups, and faith communities, consumer organisations, and civil society organizations that are engaged in project activities.

The project aims to support researchers, civil society organizations and government actors to strengthen their understanding and application of human rights-based approaches to promote healthy diets through regulatory and fiscal interventions.
